definition: to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself

sentences.english: These improved economic conditions are all helping to boost confidence.
sentences.chinese: 这些好转的经济环境对提振信心百益而无一害。

sentences.english: But Spence said that's not enough to lift the global economy out of the doldrums.
sentences.chinese: 但斯彭斯表示，这些并不足以提振停滞的全球经济。

sentences.english: The presence of US military alone will boost the economy of Subic.
sentences.chinese: 美军的存在本身就会提振苏比克的经济。

sentences.english: If this fails to happen then it may be euro positive as the markets re-adjust.
sentences.chinese: 如果预期落空，则市场重新调整的力量或提振欧元。

sentences.english: The manufacturing data boosted industrial names and companies in the materials sector.
sentences.chinese: 制造业强势提振了工业类股和能源材料行业的公司。

sentences.english: The psychology boost for the Chinese is probably near immeasurable.
sentences.chinese: 这对中国人心理上的提振起到了不可比拟的作用。

sentences.english: Buyout exits will lift both the M&A and IPO markets.
sentences.chinese: 收购再退出的操作，将同时提振并购和IPO市场。

sentences.english: If inflation tapers off, China's stockscould get a boost.
sentences.chinese: 如果通胀走低，中国的股市将得到提振。

sentences.english: A round of corporate dealmaking also gave a lift to stock futures.
sentences.chinese: 新一轮企业并购潮也提振了股市期货价格。

sentences.english: Thai stock-market prices soared on news that the Red Shirts were considering the election offer.
sentences.chinese: 受红衫军考虑阿披实提议的消息提振，泰国股市飙升。

sentences.english: Strong earnings worldwide gave European markets a lift. U.
sentences.chinese: 全球企业财报表现强劲，提振欧洲股市。

sentences.english: The threat of nationalisation has receded, reinvigorating the banks' share prices.
sentences.chinese: 国有化的威胁已经消退，提振了银行股的价格。

sentences.english: I'm just sad that I didn't get to play the Heavy Lifting Song to boost your spirits.
sentences.chinese: 只是没法唱“举重歌”来提振你们的精神真让我伤心。

sentences.english: Many countries have been urging China to boost domestic demand.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家催促中国提振国内的消费需求。

sentences.english: Other Asian arms of U.S. companies have also given HKEx a boost.
sentences.chinese: 其他美国公司的亚洲子公司也给香港股市带来了提振。

sentences.english: Too much of the boost to demand is backloaded to 2010 and beyond.
sentences.chinese: 太多急需的提振措施被推后到2010年甚至更远。

definition: (of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
(of trains) up (i.e. towards the capital)/(of river boats) to go against the current/to submit (a document) to higher authorities
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
